text: Exposure of monocytic cells to bacterial lipopolysaccharide ( LPS ) activates the NF-kappa B / Rel family of proteins and leads to the rapid induction of inflammatory gene products , including <extra_id_0> tissue factor <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> ( <extra_id_0> TF <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> ) .
<extra_id_0> TF <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> is the primary cellular initiator of the coagulation protease cascades .

Here we report the characterization of a nuclear complex from human monocytic cells that bound to a kappa B-like site , 5'-CGGAGTTTCC-3 ' , in the 5'-flanking region of the human <extra_id_0> TF <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> gene .
This nuclear complex was activated by LPS with kinetics that preceded induction of the <extra_id_0> TF <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> gene .
